page.title: 09Hanger Down,Cornwood
page.content: When the Blachford estate recently came on the market it was feared that Hanger Down might be sold off independantly to the Dinnaton country club owners,who wanted it for an 18-hole golf-course.The Down is unique in that it is separated from Dartmoor proper,while retaining all the featur- es of open moorland.A petition,bearing 1000 signatures,was devised locally, requesting the refusal of the golf course application,and the retaining of the Down in its present condition, which allows the public to enjoy its footpaths and bridlepath.Friends of the Earth,the R.S.P.B.,the Dartmoor Preservation Society,and others joined in the protest,resulting in a restric- tion being placed on the Down requir- ing any future owner to apply to the National Park committee before alter- ing the Down's purpose in anyway.
